div.p: I’m Darren, I’m an engineer and I’m currently in a career change into sports management and coaching.
On the engineering side I trained as an agricultural mechanic with horticultural and agricultural machinery i.e. tractors and everything else that’s
mechanised in the agricultural field. There could be servicing plant and machinery, repairing a breakdown if something’s
an emergency breakdown and they need it it would be to go out in a vehicle to repair it because obviously the size of some of these
implements they can’t bring them to you you’ve got to go to them so it could be driving 2 or 3 hours to get to somewhere
repair it and you don’t really know what the problem is until you get there so it’s a bit of problem solving and dealing with what’s thrown at you really
and so that’s why the timescale is you can schedule a day as in you’ve got a couple of hours to do this blah, blah, blah
but as the day goes through the schedule will be all blown out of the water because something’s taken far longer than you imagined it would.
Additionally as a hobby I did sports coaching but I found that was more... It personally developed myself so I then enrolled in a
volunteer programme to help young children in sport and I found that more enriching so I’m carrying on in that vein
and going into schools with a programme to help roll out and to teach kids movement patterns and get them off the X-box...
